Facultative reinsurance can match the terms of the original insurance policy exactly. Or it can transfer a part of the risk, such as a single location, sub-limit or deductible. Carriers buy reinsurance to protect their balance sheets against the impact of large or accumulating losses or specific exposures that are outside their risk appetite.
